summary: This document is a chain of emails from August 2019 between attorney Gloria Allred and an Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York. The emails discuss scheduling a meeting for one of Allred's clients, an Epstein victim, to meet with federal prosecutors in New York on August 19, 2019, and arranging travel for the client.

persons.name: Gloria Allred
persons.context: Attorney communicating with federal prosecutors to schedule a meeting for her client, an Epstein victim, to provide information.

persons.name: Diane Aldrich
persons.context: Allred's assistant who is to be contacted by a federal agent to arrange travel details for the client.

connections.description: Allred instructs the federal agent to contact her assistant, Diane Aldrich, to arrange travel details.
Attorney coordinating with federal prosecutor to schedule a meeting for her client, an Epstein victim.

events.title: Scheduled Meeting with Federal Prosecutors
events.description: A meeting was scheduled for Gloria Allred and her client, an Epstein victim, to meet with federal prosecutors from the Southern District of New York.

keyFacts: Attorney Gloria Allred was arranging for one of her clients, an Epstein victim, to meet with federal prosecutors in New York in August 2019.
The meeting was scheduled for August 19, 2019, at 2 p.m. at the prosecutors' office, with travel arrangements to be coordinated.
A previous client of Allred's had initially decided not to meet with prosecutors, but a different client subsequently agreed to do so.
The correspondence indicates ongoing cooperation between victim attorneys and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York in the Epstein investigation.
